prompt: You wake up and the day is already moving. Before you opened anything this week — did you know what actually mattered?
The day does not care what you intended. This past week, how often did your intentions hold anyway?
Urgency is loud. Purpose is quiet. This past week, which one drove most of your decisions?
This week — were you choosing, or were you responding? Be honest.
Your inbox arrived before your intention did. How often this week did you let that be the plan?
When the week got chaotic, did you have a direction to return to — or were you improvising all the way through?
You knew what mattered. The question is whether you protected it. This past week — did you?
When someone dropped something urgent in your lap, did your own priorities survive the collision?
The first decision of the day shapes the rest. This week, how often did you make that decision consciously?
Intention without protection is just hope. This past week, how often did you actually defend your priorities?
The people around you — do they seem like they know where they're going? Or does the day just happen to them?
When you were depleted this week, did you still choose — or did you hand the wheel to whatever was loudest?
This past month. More often intentional, or more often reactive?
When everything felt like a priority, how often did you stop and name the one thing that actually was?
Under pressure — deadline, conflict, exhaustion — did your direction hold? Or did it collapse into survival mode?
One month of days. How many of them felt like yours?
Something good happened this week. Did you let it land — or did you move to the next thing before it registered?
Your brain is scanning for threat right now. That is not a flaw. But this week — did you also let it scan for good?
Not happiness. Not performance. Real, quiet noticing of something worth something. How often this week?
When your week was hard, did you find anything in it worth a breath of appreciation — or were you just surviving?
You shared something positive with someone this week. Not to perform it. Just because it was real. Did that happen?
Under pressure, the filter narrows. This week — did yours only catch what was wrong?
Someone close to you. When did you last genuinely celebrate something with them — not acknowledge it, celebrate it?
A win happened this week. Yours or someone else's. Did it register as meaningful — or did you move past it immediately?
Not gratitude as a practice. Just noticing. This week — did anything good actually land?
Laughter. Lightness. Even for a few minutes. How often this week?
The people around you — do they experience you as someone who notices the good? Or mostly as someone who spots the problems?
When things were difficult, did you look for one honest good thing — or did the weight crowd everything else out?
This past month — were you the person who lifts the room? Or the person who doesn't notice the room?
Something came together that you worked for. Did you take a breath and feel it? Or were you already on to what's next?
Real pressure. Last month. Did joy still show up anywhere — or did it feel like an impossible luxury?
The people closest to you this past month — did they experience your joy, or mostly your stress?
Someone was talking to you this week. Were you actually there? Or were you managing the conversation from somewhere else?
Your mind races. That is normal. This week — how often did you catch it and come back?
Your most important conversation this week. Were you in it — or performing being in it?
The meeting was happening. Were you in the meeting — or in your head, already three moves ahead?
Full attention. No phone. No half-thoughts. Just there. Did you give that to anyone this week?
When things got tense around you, did you stay grounded — or did your nervous system leave the room before your body did?
You finished something this week without your mind being somewhere else. How often?
When things got uncomfortable, did you stay present — or find somewhere safer inside your head?
Yesterday. How many moments do you actually remember being fully in?
The people closest to you — do they feel like you're actually with them? Or like you're always somewhere else?
Physically in the room. Mentally somewhere else. How often this week?
Something important was happening. Did it have your full attention — or were you multitasking?
Under pressure last month, did you stay present — or did anxiety pull you into future-planning and worst-case scenarios?
Any kind of grounding ritual this past month. A breath. A pause. Something that brought you back. Did that happen?
Someone needed you to just be there. Not fix it. Not advise. Just be there. Were you able to do that?
Any moments of real stillness last month. Not rushing toward or away from something. Just still.
You knew you needed to do something this week. Fear, doubt, or discomfort got in the way. Did you do it anyway?
Uncertainty showed up this week. Did you move through it — or wait for the feeling to pass first?
Something felt risky or uncomfortable this week. Did you step toward it or away from it?
You said what you actually thought this week — even when the room might push back. How often?
Doubt is not a stop sign. This week — did you treat it like one?
You advocated for yourself this week. Your time. Your ideas. Your value. Or did you shrink to keep the peace?
A decision you delayed this week. What was the real reason you waited?
Something didn't align with what you believe is right. What did you do?
You went first this week. Shared first. Tried first. Showed up before anyone else did. Did that happen?
Your conviction, or their expectation. Which one drove more of your decisions this week?
The people around you — decisive, or still waiting for more information before moving?
Someone challenged your idea this week. Did you hold your ground — or back down?
One real risk last month. Genuinely uncertain. Did you take it anyway?
Under pressure last month — did your courage hold? Or did you play it safer than you know you should have?
A conversation you knew you needed to have. Last month. Did you have it — or find reasons not to?
This past month — leading, or waiting to be led?
When things got hard this week, did you have a reason that made it worth it — or were you just pushing through?
This week — did your daily actions feel connected to something you actually care about?
The work you did this week. Did any of it feel meaningful — genuinely, not just productive?
Someone asked why you do what you do. Did you have a clear answer? An alive one — not just a rehearsed one?
Your values, or urgency and obligation. Which one drove most of this week?
When you were depleted this week, what kept you going? Was there something pulling you forward?
Your work and your sense of purpose. This week — aligned, or running parallel?
The best moment in your work this week. What made it meaningful to you?
You hit a wall this week. Did your sense of purpose give you a way through — or did the wall just win?
The people closest to you — do they know why you do what you do? Or do they mostly see the hustle without the meaning?
This week — did you make time for anything that feeds your sense of purpose? Or just the urgent things?
An opportunity came up. Did you filter it through your values — or say yes because it was available?
Last month — did your life feel pointed somewhere? Somewhere you actually want to go?
Under pressure last month, did you lose the thread of why this matters — or were you able to hold onto it?
Any clear moments last month of 'this is why I do this' — or has it mostly felt like going through the motions?
Your biggest investments of time and energy this past month — aligned with what you say matters most?
Different rooms, different versions of you. This week — were you adapting, or disappearing?
You said something you didn't actually mean this week. Not a lie. Just easier. How often?
Who you were at work versus at home this week. Same person — or did you leave part of yourself at the door?
Someone you respect was in the room. Did you change how you showed up — how much space you took, what you said?
You said what you actually believe — in a situation where agreement would have been easier. Did that happen this week?
Performing yourself versus being yourself. How often this week did it feel like a performance?
Something bothered you this week. Did you say something — or swallow it and move on?
Someone who knows you well. Would the way you showed up at work this week feel familiar to them?
Decisions this week — based on what you actually believe, or on what you thought others wanted to see?
Something was difficult this week. Did you let it show — or manage it so nobody would see anything was wrong?
The people around you — do they know what you actually think? Or only the version you decide to let them see?
A moment this week where you were proud of yourself — not for what you accomplished, but for who you were in it.
A conversation last month where you were fully honest — even when honesty was uncomfortable.
Under pressure last month — did your character hold? Or did stress surface a version of you that you're not proud of?
You let someone see you struggle last month. Really see it. Or did you keep the hard parts to yourself?
This past month — more often yourself, or more often a role you were playing?
A conversation this week that left you feeling genuinely connected. Not caught up — connected. Did that happen?
You listened with your full attention this week. Not planning your response. Just listening. How often?
Your most important relationship right now. When did you last invest in it — not fix it, invest in it?
You asked someone how they were doing this week and actually waited for a real answer. Did that happen?
Someone was struggling around you this week. Did you notice — and did you say something?
You made someone feel like they mattered to you this week. Not as a task. As a person. How often?
A relationship got better this week because of something you did. Or did they just stay where they were?
Someone trusted you with something vulnerable this week. A fear. A struggle. A mistake. What did you do with it?
The people closest to you — do they feel like you're genuinely interested in them? Or like they're on your agenda?
Someone needed connection more than advice this week. Did you give them connection?
You showed up for someone in a way that surprised them — more than they expected. This week?
A relationship in your life that's struggling. Do you move toward it — or away from the discomfort?
Last month — did you invest in any relationship that wasn't convenient or obligatory?
Under pressure last month — your relationships got your presence, or your leftovers?
A conversation last month that changed something. In the relationship. In someone's day. In how they saw themselves.
This past month — were you someone that people felt safe being honest with?
The plan fell apart this week. Your first move — looking for what was still possible, or writing the story about why it won't work?
This week — how often did you catch yourself assuming something couldn't be done, and stop to ask if that was actually true?
A problem this week. Did you approach it like there was a way through — or like a wall?
Feedback came in this week. Did you stay open — or did your defenses go up first?
A genuinely different perspective or approach this week. Not just heard it — actually considered it. Did that happen?
How often this week did you ask 'what else is possible here' instead of defaulting to the first answer?
The disruption arrived. Did you find another way — or did it take you out of the game?
A belief you've been carrying about your work or your life. Is it still true — or just familiar?
An idea or opportunity this week — explored just because it was interesting, without needing it to fit neatly into something you already know.
The people around you — do they experience you as someone who expands what's possible in conversations? Or narrows it?
Something felt stuck this week. Did you get creative — or just push harder?
Someone's different perspective actually landed this week. Changed your thinking, even a little. Did that happen?
Last month — did you do anything that surprised even you?
Under pressure last month — did you stay curious? Or did pressure collapse your options down to survival mode?
Last month — were you actively looking for what you might be missing? Or mostly seeing what you expected to see?
This past month — growing, or repeating what already works?
You walked into a room this week. Did something shift — did the quality of the space change when you arrived?
Before you entered a situation this week, did you decide what you were going to bring — or did you just show up?
Someone you know lights up every room they enter. When you're at your best — is that you?
You went first this week. Warmth. Encouragement. Presence. Before it was given to you. Did that happen?
Things were heavy around you this week. Did you bring any light to it — or absorb the heaviness and add to it?
You made someone feel seen this week. Not because you had to — because you chose to. How often?
You inspired someone this week — not with a speech, just by how you showed up. Did that happen?
The people around you were struggling. Did they look toward you for something — steadiness, hope, energy? And if they did, did you have it to give?
The people who depend on you. This week — did they see the version of you that you want them to model?
You led by example this week in a way that wasn't asked of you. You just did it because it's who you are.
The people closest to you — do they consistently experience you as a light? Or does that only show up sometimes?
This week — the person you want to be, or the person your circumstances made you?
Last month — a moment where your presence genuinely made a difference for someone else.
Real pressure last month. Did you radiate — or eclipse? Did you bring light into the hard moment, or did the hard moment cover yours?
Last month — were you being the change you want to see? In your home, your work, your world?
